lines.text: Are you married or happy?
Now, calm yourself. We're census takers, madam. How old are you?
What address is this?
One hundred and two.
You don't look a day over eighty.
Young man, I'm twenty-nine.
Oh, yeah?
Well, how do I look?
Oh, you look like a million.
Ah, she can't be that old. (Larry and Moe open her mouth and check her teeth.) Forty-three.
Fifty.
Forty-three!
Fifty!
Forty-three!
Fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, (mouth begins to move much faster) fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty, fifty...
Sooold American!
Roses are red, and how do you do? Drink four of these and woo, woo, woo, woo!

[after all three are unable to find anyone else to interview]
Where is everybody?
Maybe it's The Fourth of July.
The Fourth of July in October?
You never can tell... look what they did to Thanksgiving!
Boy, you got brains like Napoleon.
Napoleon's dead.
I know it.
I'm gettin' sick and tired of this! How old are you?
Ninteen!
Now we're gettin' somewhere!
Eighty-three! Twenty-seven! Twenty-two!
Why don't you make up your mind?
Pardon us, madame, we're census takers. What's your name?
And your address?
What's more important, what's your phone number? Nyuk, nyuk...
[Woman hits them with her purse]
Boy, look at that. There must be a hundred thousand people in there. We'll make a fortune!
Woo-woo!
How much is four cents times a hundred thousand?

[With shock]
Nyahhh...

[gives in, stands up straight and begins to type in the air with typewriter sound effects. Sweeps his head with the sound of the typewriter bar being pushed back. Finally pulls a strip of paper from his mouth. Reads paper]
A dollar and a half.
A dollar and a half?
That's without the tax!
Where were you born?
Lake Winnipesaukee.
How do you spell that?
W-O... woof! Make it Lake Erie I got an Uncle there!
What was your family decomposed of?
Well, I'll tell ya! There was a litter of three, and I was the one they kept! N'yuk n'yuk n'yuk!

[not realizing he is getting replies from Larry]
Pardon me sir, but I'm taking census, where were you born?
Lake Winnipesaukee.
Lake Winnip-how many in the family?
I was one of a litter of three.
Now don't tell me you're the one they kept!
Nah, I was the one they threw away!
Does your drink taste all right?
A little heavy on the Angora Bitters. In fact, I think the goat walked right through it, I'm sure.
Good morning, sir, I'm the census taker. Are you married or happy?
Hen-ry!

[Henry ducks just a vase is thrown by his wife, hitting Moe and knocking him down the stairs]
Married.

[Not realizing he is getting replies from Larry]
Pardon me sir, but I'm taking census, where were you born?
Lake Winnipesaukee.
Lake Winnip-how many in the family?
I was one of a litter of three.
Now don't tell me you're the one they kept!
Nah, I was the one they threw away!
